meanings.definition: A large pictorial representation encircling the spectator and often having real objects as a foreground.
meanings.sent1: The cyclorama at the museum showed a panoramic view of the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The theater used a cyclorama to create the illusion of a vast forest behind the actors.
meanings.sent3: When the artist accidentally painted a giant banana on the cyclorama, everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was a cyclorama of endless possibilities, stretching beyond the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The cyclorama of the ocean made me feel like I was standing on the shore, watching the waves crash.

meanings.definition: A circular or semicircular curtain or wall used as a background of a stage set to suggest unlimited space.
meanings.sent1: The theater's cyclorama created a sense of depth for the actors on stage.
meanings.sent2: The colorful lights reflected beautifully on the cyclorama, enhancing the performance.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actors accidentally bumped into the cyclorama, causing a moment of chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cyclorama of memories, each scene vividly displayed in a circular frame.
meanings.sent5: The cyclorama of stars behind the singer made it seem like she was performing under the night sky.
